body: I have updated my PR to address all the comments, please take a look.

@hachikuji Sounds good. I'm okay both ways and will wait for @junrao's feedback.

Regarding the unit tests, I'm trying to wrap my head around how to write them with proper mocking. You can see [here](https://github.com/vahidhashemian/kafka/compare/KAFKA-3144...vahidhashemian:KAFKA-3144-WITH-UNIT-TESTS?expand=1) how I've made changes to the last patch so the `OutputWriter` trait that you suggested is used. The issue now is I don't see clearly how to write the unit tests with mocking (for example, for `--describe` the main functionality is inside the protected `describeGroup()` method). This tells me perhaps further restructuring is required to make the command properly mockable, but I wanted to ask your opinion before heading down that road. Thanks.
@ijuma Sure, I will add a test for it..
@shikhar Looks like this is converging, just minor fixes and some edge cases to make sure we have right.

@ijuma 

Updates per last round of comments.  Sorry about that I should have caught those.

I don't understand why the last commit causes a regression. On my local host the same test PlaintextProducerSendTest passes fine. Also a "git pull https://github.com/apache/kafka trunk" informs me that I am up to date.
Looks like someone already submitted #1561 for this issue.

This time it's failing on ssl producer test:

`kafka.api.SslProducerSendTest > testCloseWithZeroTimeoutFromCallerThread FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: No request is complete.`
one minor question, but looks good to me

Yeah this will be a good idea to add more test cases in KTableFilterTest for this scenario.

If you think it is a transient failure, you can close / re-open this PR to trigger another Jenkins build and see if it passes.
@hachikuji  Sorry, I didn't know a pull request can be modified. So, I made some changes different from that one, and submitted them.
Is there a way to register user-defined metrics?
Thank you @hachikuji for your review.Please have a look.thanks.
The new interfaces LGTM. Great tests!

I am keeping your second fix of if (change.oldValue == null && change.newValue == null) as it suppresses unnecessary nulls in my view when there is no materialization happening. I kept a comment saying "Guozhang's second fix" for those specifically to help your review but would remove comments once you have seen them. I also added an aggregation materialization unit case.
@ijuma Can you take a look at the tests when you have time? Thanks.
@ijuma ping for review on this trivial doc fix

@rekhajoshm This change looks good to me. There are a couple similar issues that may be worth addressing here. The subscribe() which takes a `Pattern` looks like it doesn't have a null check, which may be OK for correctness (not 100% sure), but probably not what the user had in mind. Also, in assign(), we would currently raise an NPE if null was included among the topic partitions. Might be worth raising illegal argument for consistency (and to give the user a better message). What do you think?

Pinging for review now that the vote has passed.
@ijuma @junrao @gwenshap @guozhangwang @ewencp

New unit test as of this morning.

Thanks about transient failure tip.

phil

> for this scenario.

No objections in the mailing list and 3 +1s (two from committers). Jun also agrees according to Roger's comment.

Tests passed locally, merged to trunk.
LGTM
LGTM overall, just a minor comment on doc string.
Merged to trunk. Thanks @bbejeck !
LGTM. Merged to both trunk and 0.10.0.

@kawamuray Fair enough. Let's keep this API as is.

BTW could you close / re-open the PR to re-trigger another Jenkins job? The failure case is related to an issue which we believe already resolved, so just trying to double check.
+1 on a resolution on this (dated summer 2014) feature
I just added another commit with an additional minor change: changing `zk_set_acl` in `kafka.py` to a boolean, not a string boolean.
@ewencp Ping for review.
@HenryCaiHaiying I have a question about a potential race condition as I left on the previous discussion between you and @ijuma .

checkstyle failed: `
:streams:checkstyleTest[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/streams/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/JoinWindowsTest.java:101:56: '-' is not preceded with whitespace.
[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/streams/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/JoinWindowsTest.java:101:57: '-' is not followed by whitespace.
[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/streams/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/JoinWindowsTest.java:106:57: '-' is not preceded with whitespace.
[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/streams/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/JoinWindowsTest.java:106:58: '-' is not followed by whitespace.
 FAILED`
Similar checkstyle issues as in #1573 , and similar comment as well.
@mjsax I thought you are going to revert the API changes in 0.10.0 as well?
LGTM overall, one minor comment above.
Updated the javadoc according the comment, please take a look.
@guozhangwang replied to your comment
Updated for assign and pattern subscription.Please have a look @hachikuji .thanks.
Done! Thanks for review.
Closing this in favour of https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1576
@mjsax @miguno
Just realised that RocksDBWindowStore is going to need some locking/synchronization around the creating and cleaning up of segments. Looking now to try and find the least intrusive way
LGTM. Waiting for Jenkins to complete.

I am keeping your second fix of if (change.oldValue == null && change.newValue == null) as it suppresses unnecessary nulls in my view when there is no materialization happening. I kept a comment saying "Guozhang's second fix" for those specifically to help your review but would remove comments once you have seen them. I also added an aggregation materialization unit case.

There is no longer a test on change.oldValue/newValue being null and no longer a test on sendOldValues to filter out a null (so same logic for cases #2 and #3 instead of just #3); accordingly unit test cases now filter out nulls on table that use filter more aggressively.

Hello @gwenshap ,

Can you please give this PR, the code and the Wiki documentation a look over?

Thanks,
Jayesh

> From: Gwen Shapira gwen@confluent.io
> To: dev@kafka.apache.org; Jayesh Thakrar j_thakrar@yahoo.com 
> Cc: Users users@kafka.apache.org
> Sent: Wednesday, May 11, 2016 12:26 PM
> Subject: Re: [DISCUSS] KIP-59 - Proposal for a kafka broker command - kafka-brokers.sh
> 
> Hello Jayesh,
> 
> Thank you for the suggestion. I like the proposal and the new tool seems useful.
> 
> Do you already have the tool available in a github repository?
> 
> If you don't, then this would be a good place to start - there are
> many Kafka utilities in github repositories (Yahoo's Kafka Manager as
> a famous example). This way users can evaluate the usefulness of the
> new tool before we include it in core-kafka.
> 
> Gwen
Jenkins failure seems to be related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3877.
Jenkins failure related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3103.
Merged to trunk.
Merged to trunk. Leaving the JIRA ticket open for the second part. Thanks @HenryCaiHaiying .
Merged to both trunk and 0.10.0.

Actually, when I looked at the original problem again (file descriptors leaking), I realized my code didn't have the fix from the following checkin.  I don't think we need to introduce that map of channels, the following fix would be fine for now.

commit 996e29cfe8a9e5a45d4b778a84fb20479eeba469
Author: Greg Fodor gfodor@gmail.com
Date:   Mon Apr 25 13:45:51 2016 -0700

```
KAFKA-3619: File handles are leaked on .lock files of ProcessorStateManager
```
LGTM, thanks!

LGTM
ping @ijuma or @ewencp for final review/commit
@vahidhashemian Thanks for the patch! Would it be much trouble to add an integration test (e.g. in `PlaintextConsumerTest` to verify that a second call to `subscribe(Pattern)` works correctly?
@hachikuji Sure. I can do that. I had opened [KAFKA-3897](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3897) to improve regex subscription testing in a separate PR.
Left a comment again, also could you rebase again?
That works for me. Another small thing: could we change the title of the PR to reflect the problem you found (i.e. metadata should be refreshed immediately upon changing the subscription regex).
Will do that too. Thanks.

@hachikuji Actually, the PR fixes two issues. Metadata refresh fixes one (item 2 in description), and the SubscriptionType added fixes the other (item 1 in description). Do you think the title you suggested still works?
Good point. In that case, the current title probably works.
@HenryCaiHaiying do you mean the whole PR is not necessary, or there are some code changes that are worth merging? If not please feel free to close this PR and the corresponding JIRA as "duplicate".
@Ishiihara I think you want to update ConnectorPluginsResourceTest.java to validate these don't leak out in the list connectors API.
I think the fix in KAFKA-3619 should fix this problem too, I am closing this PR
@hachikuji I added an integration test that covers both reported issues. Please advise if you see an issue. Thanks.
agree @hachikuji, updated to be permissive on regex.Please have a look.thanks
LGTM, we have a test run that is currently only exhibiting other known transient failures.
hmm, error not related to this pull. jenkins, retest this please
@HenryCaiHaiying, the fix in KAFKA-3619 is not quite right, see KAFKA-3812. I think what was attempted in this PR may be needed for KAFKA-3812.
Thanks for the big chunk of work, @dguy!

Weird, some tests are randomly failing ([first](https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/4494/), [second](https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/4499/), [last](https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/4504/) try), and all of the failures are from `TestUtils.waitUntilTrue(...)`. Perhaps the default 5000 ms is not a long enough wait time? I increased the wait time on the pattern subscription tests on the third try and they all passed. None fails when I test locally.

I see some other builds, like [this](https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/4497/) and [this](https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/4487/), also failed similarly.
It's funny that there are both FakeMetricsReporter and MockMetricsReporter - maybe the first one may be dropped.
@guozhangwang your suggestions have been integrated as is now as far as I can judge. Most recent build is to bring my branch DEROME-3902 with recent trunk commits.
@gfodor If you agree that this issue has been resolved, please feel free to close this PR and the corresponding JIRA ticket as well.
LGTM
@ijuma my bad didn't see your comment earlier. what @gwenshap said :). good to merge than?
anyof @guozhangwang @dguy @enothereska @miguno
LGTM overall except some comments on the unit tests.
Left some comments. Looks good in general.

@phderome I may be misleading in my previous comment regarding the mock, that we can actually use `org.apache.kafka.test.NoOpKeyValueMapper` here to reduce duplicated code here, does that sound good to you?

@vahidhashemian LGTM overall. I ran the test a few times locally and couldn't reproduce the failure, but jenkins tends to be more erratic. The only thought that comes to mind is that we somehow don't have up-to-date metadata when the consumer joins the group the first time.
LGTM. The failure above seems related to KAFKA-1377. I was able to build locally just fine.
@hachikuji Could you please elaborate? Do you see that as a side-effect of this update, or something that still hasn't been addressed? Thanks.

@vahidhashemian I don't see an actual problem, I'm just speculating what could cause the test to timeout. If you can reproduce the failure and see the consumer logs, we should be able to tell what's going on.

Aah! Thanks for clarifying. I'll take a look at the logs. One thing I noticed happening occasionally for me locally, when I was testing my sample Java consumer, was a delay of over 20 seconds between when onPartitionsRevoked() and onPartitionsAssigned() were called. Not sure if that's related or not.
The latest patch LGTM, merged to both trunk and 0.10.0. Thanks @phderome !

@ewencp I updated the test to cover what you mentioned. Also added some comments for the three pattern subscription tests. I realized that unsubscription is actually being tested in all three, so perhaps `testPatternUnsubscription()` is redundant.
Thanks @guozhangwang  for all the patient help. This is my first open source commit!
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
Sure, merged to trunk.
Thanks @rajinisivaram, sorry for the delay I've been travelling. I'll try to look into this soon.
Thank you @ijuma for your review.Updated.Please have a look.thanks.

@mjsax  @guozhangwang  changes per review comments:
- print null for stream name if null provided from user
- added additional overloaded print method with serdes but no stream name.
- added the same overloaded print methods to KTable that exist in KStream.

I found adding the stream name to `writeAsText` a little cumbersome.  How do you feel about using the parent node name for the stream name since there are not multiple streams to discern.

 Do you feel that this is a fair compromise?

With regard to you comment that the output of `writeAsText` goes to different files anyway, it might be better to have a "prefix-KeyValuePrinter" for `print()` only and use a non-prefix KeyValuePrinter for `writeAsText`. Just an idea.
